text: Wilcox is an extinct town in Whitman County, in the U.S. state of Washington. The GNIS classifies it as a populated place. A post office called Wilcox was established in 1892, and remained in operation until 1935. Robert Wilcox, an early postmaster, gave the community its name. ==References== Category:Ghost towns in Washington (state) Category:Geography of Whitman County, Washington
title: Wilcox, Washington
